github.description: GitHub MCP server for repository management, issues, PRs, and code operations

railway.description: Railway MCP server for deployment management, service operations, and environment variables

vercel.description: Vercel MCP server for frontend deployment, domain management, and project operations

github.step1: Generate a Personal Access Token at https://github.com/settings/tokens
github.step2: Required scopes: repo, workflow, admin:org, admin:public_key, admin:repo_hook
github.step3: Replace <your_github_token> in the config with your token

railway.step1: Get your Railway API token from https://railway.app/account/tokens
railway.step2: Replace <your_railway_token> in the config with your token
railway.step3: The project_info is already filled with the correct IDs for this project

vercel.step1: Generate a Vercel token at https://vercel.com/account/tokens
vercel.step2: Required scopes: Read and Write access to deployments, projects, and domains
vercel.step3: Replace <your_vercel_token> in the config with your token
vercel.step4: Get your team_id from Vercel dashboard settings and update the config

github.create_issue: manus-mcp-cli tool call create_issue --server github --input '{"owner": "TZEK89", "repo": "affiliate-marketing-system", "title": "Issue title", "body": "Issue description"}'
github.search_code: manus-mcp-cli tool call search_code --server github --input '{"query": "hotmart repo:TZEK89/affiliate-marketing-system"}'

important_notes.security: Never commit this file with real tokens to a public repository. Use environment variables or a secrets manager.
important_notes.token_rotation: Rotate your API tokens regularly for security best practices.
important_notes.permissions: Ensure each token has only the minimum required permissions for its intended use.
important_notes.rate_limits: Be aware of API rate limits for each service (GitHub: 5000/hour, Railway: varies, Vercel: varies)
